pros:
I worked in the Singapore office.

The team is small so you get to develop, execute and manage your own projects. The director is very open to ideas and gives you the freedom and space to explore and develop your interests and skills.

The pay is decent for the non-profit industry, though the annual leave is lower than average. Healthcare benefits are pretty good!
cons: The team is very small so you will need to handle most of the admin, operational and logistical matters.

review_title: Not a place for you to grow
pros: Work life balance, minimal work to do daily
cons: zero guidance, management has no idea how to bring in revenue
